src:
Sánchez passa per sobre de la independència judicial per extradir Puigdemont: "La Fiscalia depèn del govern"
El ministeri públic replica defensant la seva "autonomia funcional" i la seva "imparcialitat"

06 Nov 2019, 10:30

El govern espanyol en funcions està fent tot el possible perquè la justícia belga extradeixi Carles Puigdemont. Ho ha explicat el president espanyol en funcions, Pedro Sánchez, en una entrevista a RNE en què ha afirmat que la Fiscalia depèn directament de l'executiu. Preguntat pel periodista sobre què estan fent perquè Puigdemont torni, ha explicat que la Fiscalia ha demanat l'activació de l'euroordre i que el Suprem l'ha ordenat. Davant la insistència de les preguntes sobre el paper de l'executiu, ha preguntat: "¿La Fiscalia de qui depèn? ¿De qui depèn?" El periodista ha respost: "Del govern espanyol?" I Sánchez ha afegit: "Doncs ja està".
L'afirmació, que posa en dubte la separació de poders, ha provocat indignació entre els fiscals. La Unió Progressista de Fiscals ha recordat al president del govern en funcions que el ministeri fiscal és "autònom" de l'executiu. També l'Associació de Fiscals ha emès un comunicat en què subratlla que la Fiscalia "és independent i no compleix ordres" del govern espanyol. Més tard ha reaccionat la Fiscalia General de l'Estat, que ha assegurat que totes les decisions que la Fiscalia ha près en el marc de la causa sobre el Procés s'han basat en "l'autonomia funcional" i la "imparcialitat" dels seus membres.



La vicepresidenta del govern espanyol en funcions, Carmen Calvo, ha defensat Pedro Sánchez i ha negat que les seves paraules mostrin "ingerència política" en la Fiscalia. El líder del PSOE ha donat a entendre que aconseguirà l'entrega de Carles Puigdemont per la influència que té l'executiu en el ministeri públic –el seu paper es limita a demanar l'extradició al jutge instructor del Tribunal Suprem– i Calvo ha assegurat que les paraules de Sánchez anaven orientades a subratllar que "tothom és igual davant la llei". "Els que no són a Espanya han de rendir comptes davant la justícia per principi d'igualtat", ha afirmat la vicepresidenta, que ha asseverat que aquest és el criteri que tant manté el govern com la Fiscalia. Calvo ha acceptat després que l'extradició de Puigdemont té a veure amb la relació del poder judicial espanyol i el poder judicial belga, i que la fiscal general "no és poder judicial, sinó que la nomena el govern". Amb tot, ha demanat a la "democràcia belga que estigui a l'altura de l'espanyola".
"Ningú està per sobre de la llei. Puigdemont és un pròfug de la justícia. Treballarem perquè el sistema judicial espanyol, amb totes les seves garanties, pugui jutjar-lo amb imparcialitat. La Fiscalia compta amb el suport del govern en la defensa de la llei i de l'interès general", ha piulat aquest migdia, després de les múltiples crítiques. Un intent de rectificació, però, que no aclareix de quina manera el govern pensa assegurar la tornada de Puigdemont a Espanya, tal com es va vantar Sánchez en el debat de candidats, ni tampoc la influència que té el govern sobre el ministeri públic, tal com ha insinuat a l'entrevista d'aquest matí.



L'oposició ha criticat durament Sánchez. El líder de Ciutadans, Albert Rivera, ha assegurat que "no podem tenir un president tirant per terra la feina de fiscals, advocats de l’Estat, funcionaris, gent que em consta que el juguen la vida i el tipus per defensar la democràcia”. El candidat del partit taronja s’ha mostrat confiat que, “malgrat” Sánchez i Miquel Iceta, Puigdemont acabarà sent jutjat a Espanya.
De la seva banda, el president del Senat i candidat del PSC a la cambra alta el 10-N, Manuel Cruz, ha defensat en una roda de premsa a l'ACN que quan Sánchez es compromet a retornar Puigdemont parla com a "representant de l'Estat": "No té cap eina per a una iniciativa com aquesta", ha argumentat. Tot i això, ha afirmat que el govern espanyol en funcions pot "instar la Fiscalia a un determinat comportament", en relació a la petició d'extradició de l'expresident de la Generalitat. Malgrat matisar que és el ministeri públic qui ha d'"executar" i que no hi ha un "ordeno i mano", ha afirmat que hi ha una "cadena" entre l'executiu i el fiscal. "Una cadena que no impedeix l'autonomia de la Fiscalia", ha insistit.
En l'entrevista, Sánchez ha tirat pilotes fora quan se li ha preguntat per les declaracions de Pablo Casado al debat organitzat per TVE en què va insinuar que Sánchez coneixia el contingut de la sentència del Procés abans que es fes pública i ha denunciat l'ús que n'ha fet l'independentisme. "L’independentisme pot utilitzar les declaracions com li vingui de gust perquè viu en una realitat paral·lela i es munta les seves bombolles", ha dit.




Sánchez ho fia tot a la mà dura amb Catalunya

Advertiment a l'independentisme
Sánchez ha advertit "els grups radicals independentistes" de les responsabilitats penals que pot tenir impedir el dret a vot el 10-N, després que ahir la Junta Electoral de Barcelona descartés desallotjar l'acampada a la plaça Universitat si no interferia en les votacions. El president espanyol en funcions ha valorat molt positivament la coordinació amb els Mossos d'Esquadra durant els aldarulls i ha explicat que s'ha desplegat "un nombre important" de cossos i forces de seguretat per garantir el vot.




La Junta Electoral descarta desallotjar l'acampada i ordena als Mossos garantir que no interfereixi en les eleccions

Sánchez vol recuperar ara la tipificació de la convocatòria de referèndums com a delicte al Codi Penal perquè l'independentisme està dient que ho tornarà a fer i perquè assegura que la majoria ha votat en contra de la independència en reiterats comicis. "La societat catalana ha dit en moltes ocasions que vol continuar a Espanya", ha dit.
El president espanyol en funcions, que ha tornat a denunciar l'ús sectari dels mitjans de televisió públics per part de l'independentisme, manté la duresa en el to i s'espolsa responsabilitats. "El que han de fer és seure amb els no independentistes a Catalunya per trobar un espai de diàleg, perquè es tracta d'una crisi de convivència", ha dit, i ha retret que no vulguin facilitar la governabilitat a Espanya i que vulguin propiciar més inestabilitat.
Sánchez demana als partits que deixin governar la llista més votada
"No podem anar a unes terceres eleccions. No es pot imposar el bloqueig, haurem de posar-nos d’acord. I, si no, que deixin governar a la llista més votada". Sánchez ha demanat que si els partits no aconsegueixen pactar per formar govern després de les eleccions del 10-N deixin governar a la llista més votada – les enquestes preveuen que serà la dels socialistes–, tal com ja va demanar durant el debat dels candidats estatals organitzat per TVE.




Les enquestes dibuixen un PSOE en mans d’ERC o del PP

El president ha apel·lat al vot útil contra el bloqueig i ha expressat el seu compromís amb un govern progressista, tot i que no descarta demanar l'abstenció al PP i Cs si s'ha d'enfrontar a una investidura. En aquest sentit, ha carregat contra Iglesias i contra la dreta per provocar el bloqueig després dels últims comicis i ha demanat un compromís dels partits per desbloquejar el govern de cara a l'endemà de les eleccions, per deixar de tenir un govern en funcions com a molt tard al desembre. Sánchez ha reiterat els tres puntals fonamentals per al PSOE en la formació del nou govern: estabilitat, acord progressista i respecte a la legalitat –en referència a l'independentisme.
text:
Sanchez passes over judicial independence to extradite Puigdemont: "The prosecutor's office depends on the government"
The public ministry responds by defending its "functional autonomy" and its "impartiality"

06 Nov 2019, 10:30

The Spanish government is doing its best to make Belgian justice extradite Carles Puigdemont. This was explained by the Spanish President, Pedro Sánchez, in an interview with RNE in which he said that the Prosecutor's Office is directly dependent on the executive. Asked by the journalist about what they are doing so that Puigdemont returns, he explained that the Office of the Prosecutor has asked for the activation of the euroordre and that the Supreme has ordered it. In the face of the insistence of the questions about the role of the executive, he asked: "The prosecutor's office to whom depends? Who depends?" The reporter responded: "From the Spanish government?" And Sánchez added: "Well, that's it."
The statement, which calls into question the separation of powers, has caused indignation among the prosecutors. The Progressive Progress Union has reminded the acting government's president that the fiscal ministry is "autonomous" of the executive. Also the Association of Public Prosecutors has issued a statement in which he emphasizes that the Public Prosecutor's Office "is independent and does not comply with the orders" of the Spanish government. The General State Prosecutor's Office subsequently reacted, which said that all the decisions taken by the Prosecutor General in the context of the case on the Process were based on "functional autonomy" and "impartiality" of the its members



The vice-president of the Spanish government in charge, Carmen Calvo, has defended Pedro Sánchez and has denied that his words show "political interference" in the Office of the Prosecutor. The leader of the PSOE has shown that he will be able to deliver Carles Puigdemont due to the influence the executive has on the public ministry - his role is limited to request extradition to the Supreme Court instructional judge and Calvo has assured that Sánchez's words were aimed at underlining that "everyone is equal before the law." "Those who are not in Spain must file their accounts before the courts on the principle of equality," said the vice president, who asserted that this is the criterion that both the government and the public prosecutor maintain. Calvo accepted after the extradition of Puigdemont has to do with the relationship between the Spanish judiciary and the Belgian judiciary, and that the general prosecutor "is not a judicial power, but the government is appointed". However, he has called for "Belgian democracy that is at the height of Spanish".
"No one is above the law. Puigdemont is a fugitive of justice. We will work so that the Spanish judicial system, with all its guarantees, can judge it impartially. The Prosecutor's Office has the support of the government in defense of the law and the general interest, "said this afternoon, after the many criticisms. An attempt at rectification, however, that does not clarify how the government plans to ensure the return of Puigdemont to Spain, as Sánchez won in the debate of candidates, nor the influence of the government on the public ministry, such as he hinted at this morning's interview.



The opposition has harshly criticized Sánchez. Citizen leader Albert Rivera said that "we can not have a president by landing the work of prosecutors, state attorneys, civil servants, people who know that they play life and type to defend democracy" The candidate of the Orange party has been confident that, "in spite of" Sánchez and Miquel Iceta, Puigdemont will be judged in Spain.
Meanwhile, the president of the Senate and candidate of the PSC in the upper house on 10-N, Manuel Cruz, has defended at a press conference at the ACN that when Sanchez commits himself to return, Puigdemont speaks as "representative of the State ":" It has no tool for an initiative such as this one, "he argued. In spite of this, he said that the Spanish government in functions can "urge the Public Prosecutor's Office to perform a certain behavior", in relation to the request for extradition of the former president of the Generalitat. Despite pointing out that the public ministry must "execute" and that there is no "order and hand", he said that there is a "chain" between the executive and the prosecutor. "A chain that does not impede the autonomy of the Office of the Prosecutor", he insisted.
In the interview, Sanchez has thrown balls out when asked about the statements of Pablo Casado to the debate organized by TVE in which he insinuated that Sanchez knew the content of the sentence of the Process before it was made public and denounced the " use made by independentism. "Independence can use the statements as he likes because he lives in a parallel reality and mounts his bubbles," he said.




Sánchez put everything in his tough hand with Catalonia

Warning to independence
Sánchez warned "radical radicals independentistas" of the criminal responsibilities that may have prevented the right to vote on 10-N, after yesterday the Electoral Board of Barcelona discarded evacuate the camp in the Plaza Universidad if not interfered in voting. The Spanish president in functions has valued very positively the coordination with the Mossos d'Esquadra during the disturbances and explained that an "important number" of bodies and security forces has been deployed to guarantee the vote.




The Electoral Board discards to evict the camp and orders the Mossos to guarantee that it does not interfere in the elections

Sánchez now wants to recover the call for referendums as a crime in the Criminal Code because independence is saying he will do it again and because he says that most have voted against independence in repeated elections. "Catalan society has said on many occasions that it wants to continue in Spain," he said.
The Spanish President in office, who has once again denounced the sectarian use of public television media by independentism, maintains the harshness in the tone and takes responsibility. "What they have to do is sit down with non-independentists in Catalonia to find a space for dialogue, because it is a crisis of coexistence," he said, and said that they do not want to facilitate governability in Spain and that they want to encourage more instability
Sánchez asks the parties to rule the most voted list
"We can not go to third elections. The blockade can not be imposed, we will have to agree. And if not, let them rule in the most voted list." Sánchez asked that if parties do not agree to form a government after the 10-N elections, they will rule on the most voted list - surveys predict that it will be that of the Socialists - as he already asked during the debate of the state candidates organized by TVE.




Surveys draw a PSOE into the hands of ERC or the PP

The president has appealed to the vote against the blockade and expressed his commitment to a progressive government, although it does not rule out requesting abstention from the PP and Cs if it has to face an investiture. In this regard, he charged against Iglesias and the right to cause the blockade after the last elections and called for a commitment of the parties to unblock the government with regard to the day after the elections, to stop having a government in functions such as no later than December. Sánchez reiterated the three fundamental pillars for the PSOE in the formation of the new government: stability, progressive agreement and respect for legality - in reference to independence.
